data.enText: simple and not very accurate but giving a general idea of sth

data.chText: 简略地说，导致精神病的原因看起来主要有三种。
data.enText: In crude terms , the causes of mental illness seem to be of three main kinds.

before.enText: of objects or works of art

data.enText: simply made, not showing much skill or attention to detail
a crude drawing of a face

data.chText: 冒犯的，粗俗的，粗鲁的（尤其有关性的）

before.enText: of people or the way they behave

data.enText: offensive or rude, especially about sex

before.enText: of oil and other natural substances

data.enText: in its natural state, before it has been treated with chemicals

data.chText: 简而言之，穷人无饭吃，富人才有车开。
data.enText: To put it crudely, the poor are going without food so that the rich can drive cars.
oil in its natural state, before it has been treated with chemicals

simple_means.memory_skill: crud 生的 + e → 粗糙的；原始的

means: 冒犯的，粗俗的，粗鲁的(尤其有关性的)

ex.chText: 这是一种自然现象，几乎每个世纪都要发生一次。
ex.enText: This is a natural phenomenon that happens about once a century.

ex.chText: 她做饭只用纯天然的佐料。
ex.enText: She cooks with natural ingredients only.

synonyms.bx: 指存在或发生于自然界的，含非人力所为之意，也指食物没有添加其他成分的。

ex.chText: 汽油是从原油中提炼出来的。
ex.enText: Gasoline is made from crude oil.

ex.chText: 他们从马来西亚进口生胶。
ex.enText: They imported crude rubber from Malaysia.

synonyms.bx: 主要指石油、橡胶等未经化学加工、尚处于自然状态的，只作定语。

ex.chText: 这家工厂经常原料不足。
ex.enText: The factory is in frequent scarcity of raw materials.

ex.chText: 他也用自己的船从美国进口原棉。
ex.enText: He also imported raw cotton from America in his own ships.

synonyms.bx: 指物质未经加工、依然处于自然状态的。

ex.chText: 未提炼的猪油/原糖/未精制的糖浆

synonyms.bx: 指物质处于天然或未经精炼状态的，通常含有其他杂质。

synonym.guide: 导航词义：自然的，天然的

ex.chText: 为什么这张粗糙的木桌如此昂贵？
ex.enText: Why was this rough wooden table so expensive?

ex.chText: 皮肤粗糙是困扰很多人的常见问题。
ex.enText: Rough skin is a very common problem affecting many people.

synonyms.bx: 指制作不够精细的，或表面不平滑的。

ex.chText: 她粗糙的双手是常年艰辛劳作的结果。
ex.enText: Her coarse hands are the result of years of hard work.

ex.chText: 他新买的粗羊毛夹克衫不保暖。
ex.enText: His new jacket of coarse wool failed to keep him warm.

ex.chText: 如果你想做出美味的蛋糕，那么不要用粗盐。
ex.enText: Coarse salt shouldn't be used if you want to make tasty cakes.

synonyms.bx: 指皮肤或布料不光滑的，也指构成部分粗大的。

ex.chText: 尽管工艺粗糙，这款花瓶销量很好。
ex.enText: In spite of its crude workmanship, this type of vase sells well.

ex.chText: 他只能描画出窃贼脸部的大致轮廓。
ex.enText: He can only provide a crude drawing of the thief's face.

synonyms.bx: 指制作水平不高、细节欠雕琢打磨的。

ex.chText: 真的有人能够在那件简陋的小木屋里生活一年吗？
ex.enText: Is there anyone who can really live in that rude wooden hut for one year?

synonyms.bx: 指房屋简陋的，或设施不完备的。

tr: a dark oil consisting mainly of hydrocarbons
not processed or subjected to analysis

example: full of language so vulgar it should have been edited

tr: belonging to an early stage of technical development
example: the crude weapons and rude agricultural implements of early man
primitive living conditions in the Appalachian mountains
managed to make a crude splint
a crude cabin of logs with bark still on them

value.def: A crude method or measurement is not exact or detailed, but may be useful or correct in a rough, general way.

example.ex: Standard measurements of blood pressure are an important but crude way of assessing the risk of heart disease or strokes...
example.tran: 标准的血压测量是评估患心脏病或中风几率的一个重要但不精确的方法。

example.ex: Birthplace data are only the crudest indicator of actual migration paths.
example.tran: 出生地信息只能非常粗略地显示实际移民过程。

example.ex: The donors can be split — a little crudely —  into two groups...
example.tran: 捐献者可以大致分为两组。

example.ex: Put crudely, the liberationists favour extending a number of rights to children.
example.tran: 大致来说，妇女解放论者希望将一些权利延伸至儿童。

value.def: If you describe an object that someone has made as crude, you mean that it has been made in a very simple way or from very simple parts.

example.ex: In some places maps are scarce, and are often crudely produced.
example.tran: 有些地方很少有地图，而且通常绘制得都很粗糙。

value.def: If you describe someone as crude, you disapprove of them because they speak or behave in a rude, offensive, or unsophisticated way.

example.ex: Nev! Must you be quite so crude?
example.tran: 尼夫！你非得那么粗俗吗？

value.tran: 冒犯的;粗鲁的;不精明的

example.ex: He hated it when she spoke so crudely...
To put it crudely, nobody really gives a toss about this any more.
example.tran: 说难听的，没人会真的再在乎这种事了。

example.ex: He had not expected such crudity from so sophisticated a minister.
example.tran: 他真没想到如此见多识广的部长竟会这么幼稚。

example.ex: Crudeness is on the rise in all fields of entertainment.
example.tran: 所有娱乐领域都日益粗俗化。

value.def: Crude substances are in a natural or unrefined state, and have not yet been used in manufacturing processes.

partsOfSpeech.dec: crud 生的 + e → 粗糙的；原始的
crud 生的 + e + ly …地 → 天然地，未加工地；不成熟地
partsOfSpeech.d: 天然地，未加工地；不成熟地

partsOfSpeech.dec: crud 生的 + e + ness 性质，状态 → 天然的状态；不成熟；生硬
partsOfSpeech.d: 天然的状态；不成熟；生硬

partsOfSpeech.dec: crud 生的 + ification 形成…，…化 → 粗制滥造
crud 生的 + ity 具备某种性质，状况 → 粗糙；不成熟状态
